lead_paragraph: Chelsea advanced to the European Champions League final for the first time, with Frank Lampard returning after the death of his mother to score the go-ahead goal Wednesday in a 3-2 overtime victory over Liverpool. Didier Drogba scored twice for the Blues, who won the home-and-home series by 4-3 on aggregate. They will meet Manchester United at Moscow on May 21 in the first all-English final in the competition’s 52-year history. Lampard, whose mother died of pneumonia at age 58 last Thursday, converted a penalty kick in the eighth minute of overtime after Michael Ballack was fouled.
